title: Schrager's mock draft: 32 predictions based on sources in the league
content: Peter Schrager's debut piece for ESPN is a Round 1 mock draft based on what he's hearing from his sources.

title: Ward huge favorite to be No. 1 pick of NFL draft
content: Miami QB Cam Ward is a big favorite to be the No. 1 pick in the NFL draft, and odds-on favorites also have emerged at picks two through five at sportsbooks around the nation.

title: Sources: Bucks, Horst reach multiyear extension
content: The Bucks have reached a multiyear extension with GM Jon Horst, sources told ESPN. Milwaukee has made the playoffs in all eight of Horst's seasons as GM.

title: Bloodied KP fires up C's: Won't let teams 'punk us'
content: Kristaps Porzingis laughed off a bloody gash on his forehead late in the third quarter of Boston's Game 2 win, saying he knew his reaction would fire up the Celtics crowd.

title: TGL considers expansion, adding women's league
content: Expansion of the tech-infused TGL will start with one additional team, while bringing in LPGA stars for a women's league also is under consideration.

title: Mavs coach Kidd joins Everton ownership group
content: Dallas Mavericks head coach Jason Kidd has joined the ownership group of Everton, the Premier League club announced on Thursday.

title: Warriors' Butler exits after hard fall, set for MRI
content: Warriors star Jimmy Butler suffered a pelvis contusion that forced him out of the Game 2 loss to the Rockets.

title: Titans add veteran WR Lockett on eve of draft
content: The Titans are signing veteran wide receiver Tyler Lockett to a one-year, $4 million deal that could be worth up to $6 million, a source told ESPN.

title: Traore, projected top-20 pick, to enter NBA draft
content: French guard Nolan Traore, a projected top-20 pick, will enter the 2025 NBA draft, he told ESPN on Thursday.

title: Cheat sheet: Everything you need to know on top prospects, team needs, projections
content: Who are the best players in the class? Which teams need a QB? Here's our one-stop guide to the draft.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: Can Senators, Blues turn the tide at home?
content: Both clubs are down 0-2 heading into Game 3. Plus, it's Game 2 of the Battle of Florida! Here's what to know.

title: Bad Boys and 'Detroit energy': What's behind this record-setting turnaround for the Pistons
content: The Pistons finished with one of the worst records in NBA history last season. Now, they enter Thursday's Game 3 tied 1-1 with the Knicks. What changed in Detroit?

title: The fishing ad that foreshadowed this incredible resurgence from Kawhi Leonard
content: Recent dominance has shown what kind of player Leonard still is -- and what his career could have been.

title: Welcome to the Cheap Seats at Clemson, home of college baseball's rowdiest fans
content: Fans in the raucous right-field grandstand at Doug Kingsmore Stadium have been ragging opposing teams for more than two decades.

title: Ian Darke's Premier League flops of the season: Højlund, Foden, more
content: It's not been the easiest season for Man United or Rasmus Højlund, but who else has notably underperformed in the Premier League this season? Ian Darke makes his picks.

title: Bundesliga's race for Europe: Can Dortmund come back to reach UCL?
content: The Bundesliga table is tight near the top, with 11 teams possessing real and achievable European aspirations.

title: Madrid's Camavinga (adductor) out for season
content: Real Madrid midfielder Eduardo Camavinga will miss the remainder of the season, including Saturday's Copa del Rey final against Barcelona, because of a left adductor injury.

title: Sources: Arsenal confident in Zubimendi deal
content: Arsenal are confident they will make Real Sociedad midfielder Martín Zubimendi their first major summer signing despite interest from Real Madrid, sources have told ESPN.

title: Ancelotti scolds Endrick for 'clowning' vs. Getafe
content: Real Madrid coach Carlo Ancelotti has scolded Endrick after his missed goal-scoring opportunity in Wednesday's 1-0 LaLiga win at Getafe.

title: Kane set to end trophy drought as Bayern eye title
content: Bayern Munich will secure the Bundesliga title on Saturday with a win over top-four hopefuls Mainz if rivals and reigning champions Bayer Leverkusen fail to beat Augsburg.

title: Man United women to play in $5m World 7s event
content: Manchester United will take part in the inaugural World Sevens football tournament at the end of May in Portugal.

title: Vardy to leave Leicester: 'Our greatest-ever player'
content: Jamie Vardy will leave Leicester City at the end of the season, the Premier League club confirmed on Wednesday.

title: Miami trades forward Robert Taylor to Austin FC
content: Inter Miami CF traded forward Robert Taylor to Austin FC for $750,000 in allocation money, the two clubs announced Monday.

title: Arena: Poch doesn't understand culture of USMNT
content: Former USMNT coach Bruce Arena has criticized the appointment of current head coach Mauricio Pochettino, saying that a non-American lacks the necessary understanding of the country's culture.

title: For Rich Rodriguez and West Virginia is second time a charm?
content: Rodriguez led West Virginia to prominence when he was its head coach in the aughts. Can he work his magic again in 2025?

title: Stanley Cup Playoffs Central: Bracket, schedule, scores, news
content: From the first round all the way through the Stanley Cup Final, ESPN has you covered this NHL postseason.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs odds: Stars a top 5 favorite after Game 3 win over Avalanche
content: Every playoff team's odds to win the Stanley Cup and favorites for the Conn Smythe Trophy for playoff MVP.

title: How does Cam Ward compare to other QBs who boosted draft stock in final collegiate season?
content: Cam Ward didn't finish his career where he started, but he went out strong. Here are other QBs who have done the same.

title: Bracketology: First look at 2026 has familiar teams on top line
content: South Carolina, UConn, UCLA and Texas are the No. 1 seeds in our first projection of the 2026 bracket.

title: Rankings, projections, strategy and cheat sheets
content: Rankings, projections, player profiles, draft strategies -- we've got everything you need to dominate your fantasy women's basketball draft from every angle.

title: Tucker finishes 2025 as fantasy's No. 1? Alonso hits .300? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: Chris Eubank Jr.-Conor Benn timeline: How their rivalry unfolded
content: Nick Parkinson looks at the rivalry between Eubank and Benn that started decades ago between their fathers.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal, Liverpool join Huijsen race
content: Arsenal, Chelsea, Liverpool and Newcastle United are all after Bournemouth's Spain international defender Dean Huijsen. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Thompson leads USWNT in ranking, but other internationals dominate
content: The NWSL MVP Tracker is back for 2025 to rank the best players, as Alyssa Thompson tries to catch Debinha and Temwa Chawinga.

title: EA Sports F1 25 preview: Aiming for the championships with Braking Point
content: Braking Point returns in EA F1 25, with new difficulty levels and a continuation of the game's story.

title: Protest against move to permit new house boats in Alappuzha
content: Move poses serious threat to the fragile ecosystem of Vembanad Lake and can jeopardise the strained houseboat tourism sector in Alappuzha, say protesters

title: Baruipur police dismiss Suvendu Adhikari’s claim of ‘suspicious’ device installation by alleged Kashmiris
content: As verification revealed the individuals in question are from Madhya Pradesh, police urged against the spreading of unverified information online

title: 15-year-old boys among the attackers, says Pahalgam victim’s son
content: After his father Sushil Nathaniel’s last rites in Indore, son Austen says the gunmen even pulled down pants of victims to confirm their religious identity before shooting them

title: Issue public notice for removal of unauthorised emblems, symbols, stickers, names and logos from public and private vehicles within four weeks: Karnataka High Court
content: ‘There an unfortunate tendency amongst ex-MPs, ex-MLAs of misusing emblems and symbols on their letterheads and vehicles’

title: It was a deadly gamble, but I had no choice, Jain Kurian recounts his escape from Russia
content: The youth from Wadakkancherry was forcibly enlisted into the Russian Army and got injured in the Russia-Ukraine war zone

title: New batch of AI online training by KITE from May 10
content: Admission will be given to the first 2,500 people who register. Applications can be submitted till May 3

title: Late start no barrier to her special UPSC victory
content: A 40-year-old aurally challenged woman cracks the Civil Services Examination in her seventh attempt, securing the 1,000th rank

title: Jammalamadugu to contribute amount as financial assistance to Indian Army: Adinarayana Reddy
content: The former Minister calls the recent Pahalgam attack as an act of cowardice aimed at disturbing peace in the State of Jammu and Kashmir

title: Munnar receives more tourist enquiries in the wake of Kashmir terrorist attack
content: Stakeholders think tourists, especially those from north India, will shift their travel plans to Munnar instead of Kashmir as climate and topography of the destinations are almost the same

title: Police bust ganja peddling gang in Nellore
content: Santhapeta police arrest a gang of five persons for selling ganja and seize 5 kg ganja worth ₹2.5 lakh from them

title: A forgotten hero re-emerges as Congress, BJP lay claim to his legacy
content: Chettur Sanakaran Nair, a trailblazing figure who made history as the sole Malayali to hold the office of the Indian National Congress president in 1897, has faded from memory largely due to the party’s own oversight and flawed narrative

title: NDA alliance rule in A.P. is disastrous, says former MP
content: Incumbent government marked by rampant corruption, nepotism and indifference to the plight of the poor, alleges senior CPI(M) leader P. Madhu

title: Anjuman-e-Islam stages protests against terror attack in Pahalgam
content: Condemning the attack, members of the Muslim organisation submit memoranda seeking stringent action against terrorists

title: Opposition protest disrupts Kannur Corporation Council meet
content: The meeting, which began at 11 a.m., was wrapped up within five minutes after Mayor Muslih Madathil rushed through the agenda amid the chaos

title: No confidence motion in KSCARD Bank passed, but declaration of results put on hold
content: Director board, which has a UDF majority, has maintained that neither  Cooperative Societies Act nor bylaw of KSCARD Bank provides for no confidence motion

title: Srisailam temple officials to preserve ancient sites and scriptures
content: The ancient inscriptions and structures at Srisailam temple stand as a testimony that the famous temple had once flourished as a centre for spiritual, cultural, education and medicine, says Srisailam temple EO

title: Bindu inaugurates Kerala Institute of Science, Technology and Innovation at M.G. University
content: Centres of Excellence envisioned to improve quality of life and strengthen economic foundations of society based on knowledge, says Minister

title: Ensure drinking water supply during summer in Krishna district, Minister tells officials
content: Vasamsetti Subhash expresses happiness at the students from the district scoring well in both Class X and Inter examinations

title: General Hospital in Thiruvananthapuram set to have a major makeover
content: Govt. accords sanction to the ₹137.35-crore project that will be funded by the KIIFB. The new buildings will have specialty and superspecialty services, multi-disciplinary ICU, advanced trauma care, dialysis, and chemotherapy facilities

title: Mundra drugs haul case accused says his children were bullied in school after NIA claims in Supreme Court
content: The National Investigation Agency has claimed that proceeds of crime were funnelled to the Lashkar-e-Taiba to finance terror attacks like in Pahalgam

title: Minister promises to look into enhancing recurring expenses of KMCRI in Hubballi
content: Sharanprakash Patil has said that he will take up the demand with the Finance Department after verifying data for the last three years

title: Tweaking trouble in tinseltown
content: A few actors of Mollywood are under the cloud of suspicion for substance abuse. G. Krishnakumar and M.P. Praveen delve into the issue of drug menace plaguing Malayalam cinema

title: Unused govt. land to be identified for LIFE Mission in Kozhikode
content: The Collector is authorised to take over such identified plots without requiring No-Objection Certificates from landholders, says a government order

title: Pawan Kalyan orders audit of lands belonging to  Gram Panchayats in Andhra Pradesh
content: This will enable the government to find out encroachments and reclaim the occupied lands, he says; he proposes a national integration complex and a pylon in every village to foster the spirit of unity and patriotism

title: Minister launches free online DSC coaching through Acharya app for marginalised groups
content: The app provides interactive features such as subject-wise Q&A through a live chatbox and technical support via WhatsApp groups, says S. Savitha

title: Protest Pahalgam terror attack by wearing black armbands to Friday prayers: Owaisi
content: The AIMIM president welcomed Home Minister Amit Shah meeting victim’s family and described it as a good move which was not an easy thing to do

title: CM promises to make Sabarimala airport a reality
content: Chief Minister addresses district-level meeting in Pathanamthitta to mark the fourth anniversary of his government

title: Self-financing college teachers under Calicut University pin hopes on Syndicate meeting
content: The last Syndicate meeting, held on March 20, had decided that only those who had cleared the National Eligibility Test (NET) of the University Grants Commission (UGC) would be allowed to continue as faculty members in the colleges from the next academic year

title: Officials told to prioritise clean water supply to tackle summer challenges in rural areas
content: Ballari district in-charge Secretary K.V. Trilok Chandra chairs Karnataka Development Programme progress review meeting

title: West Bengal leaders pay tribute to Army Havildar killed in J&K anti-terror operation
content: Trinamool Congress leaders hailed Havildar Jhantu Ali Shaikh, who made the supreme sacrifice in the line of duty, and referred to him as the ‘Hero of Bengal’

title: Jaggi brothers: How the Gensol founders fell
content: Heralded as India’s ‘serial entrepreneurs’, Anmol and Puneet Jaggi are now barred by SEBI from holding any directorial post in their company Gensol

title: Karnataka Cabinet approves projects worth ₹3,647.62 crore in special meeting at M.M. Hills
content: Chief Minister rebuts Opposition claims that funds are being diverted to guarantee schemes and seeks to know how projects can be approved without securing funds

title: A.P. Minister urges medical fraternity to strengthen healthcare in government hospitals
content: As government hospitals are the hope of the low-income groups, they should provide the public with consistent, accessible, and reliable healthcare, says Mandipalli Ramprasad Reddy

title: EPF scheme is most suited for construction workers, says Provident Fund Commissioner
content: EPF, through its contributory, account-linked, and tech-enabled framework, offers a far more resilient, scalable, and sustainable approach to worker’s protection and interest, says commissioner

title: Accused awarded death sentence in Ambalamukku murder case
content: Kanyakumari native Rajendran fatally stabbed Vineetha at the nursery she was working in the capital and stole her gold chain weighing 4.5 sovereigns. He is the prime accused in a 2014 triple homicide in Tamil Nadu

title: Vast scope for growth of aerospace and defence manufacturing sector in Andhra Pradesh, says former DRDO chief Satheesh Reddy
content: He promises to work with officials concerned in identifying locations for developing defence clusters

title: Thiruvathukkal twin murder: Assam native remanded in judicial custody
content: He tells police that he had only intended to target Vijayakumar but killed Meera as well after she woke up on hearing the noise

title: 25 highly accident-prone zones identified in Chittoor district
content: Collector instructs police and road transport authorities to chalk out an action plan to ground corrective measures at the black spots

title: CWC-TAC recommends techno-economic viability nod for Sitarama LI, Sitammasagar projects
content: The clearance is set to pace up the multipurpose project works with the committee meet chaired by MoJS Secretary clearing DPR

title: Dharwad officials asked to implement govt. schemes effectively
content: Labour Minister has directed taluk panchayat executive officers to resolve any drinking water problems immediately

title: Jagan pays tributes to terror victims; pats YSRCP leaders for bypoll performance
content: Party rank and file showed commitment during the recent byelections and the no-confidence motions were a testament to the strength of the party, he says

title: VTU asks students to cultivate wide reading habit
content: The university’s centres of excellence are training students in entrepreneurship, according to Vice-Chancellor

title: More than 350 people killed in road accidents annually in Chittoor district: SP
content: Manikanta Chandolu flags off a bike rally, split into three groups, which covered the vital junctions of Murakambattu, Reddygunta and Sambayya Kandriga, to promote the compulsory wearing of helmets

title: TNSTC plans to reschedule bus routes after the new bus stand at Panjapur becomes operational
content: The average distance per trip for the city buses may increase by 5 km, say officials; all the buses from Panjapur will go via Central Bus Stand and Tiruchi Junction

title: India's 7 Big Steps Against Pak After Pahalgam Terror Attack
content: India has taken seven steps against Pakistan following the terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam that killed 26. The government yesterday announced five steps after discussing cross-border linkages of the attack, and two more actions today.

title: BluSmart Co-Founder Puneet Jaggi Detained From Delhi Hotel: Sources
content: EV cab service BluSmart co-founder Puneet Jaggi has been detained from a hotel in Delhi by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in a money laundering case linked to Gensol Group, another company that he co-founded, sources said today.

title: Trump Calls Harvard "Liberal Mess" As Funding Dispute Heads To Court
content: US President Donald Trump on Thursday bashed Harvard as an "Anti-Semitic, Far Left Institution," as the prestigious university battles his administration's funding freeze in court.

title: Routes, Duration: How Pakistan Airspace Closure Will Affect Indian Flights
content: International flights, especially from Delhi and other northern cities, will take a longer time to reach their destinations and fares are also likely to rise in the range of 8-12 per cent in the near term, with Pakistan closing its airspace for India

title: "Full Support For Any Action": Rahul Gandhi After All-Party Meet On Pahalgam
content: The Opposition has fully backed the government for "any action", condemning the Pahalgam massacre that has cost 26 lives and unleashed one of the worst face-offs with Pakistan.

title: US Now Wants H-1B Holders To Provide Biometrics, Home Addresses
content: Immigration officials are issuing Requests for Evidence (RFEs) in H-1B visa cases, seeking personal data, including home addresses and biometrics. This move has sparked questions about the federal agency's intentions.

title: Pahalgam Terror Attack Live Updates: Intelligence Officials Briefed All-Party Meet On Attack, Lapse, Says Kiren Rijiju
content: Pahalgam terror attack updates: Twenty six tourists died in the attack in Jammu & Kashmir's Pahalgam on Tuesday. Both India and Pakistan have imposed severe measures against each other.

title: India's Rafales Simulate "Ground Attack Missions" In Significant Exercise
content: The Indian Air Force is carrying out Exercise Aakraman (Attack) over a large area in the central sector involving its mainstream fighter aircraft fleets led by the Rafale combat aircraft.

title: Probe Agency Arrests Former Rajasthan Minister Mahesh Joshi In Money Laundering Case
content: The Enforcement Directorate Thursday arrested Congress leader and former Rajasthan minister Mahesh Joshi in a money laundering case linked to alleged irregularities in the Jal Jeevan Mission scheme, officials said.

title: Canada Election 2025: A Look Back At Country's First Election In 1867
content: With Canada preparing to go to polls next week, it is a fitting moment to look back at the country's first-ever general election, held in 1867.

title: What Voting Looked Like In Canada Before Its Poll Body Took Over
content: The Canadian electoral system was in place well before the creation of Elections Canada. After Confederation in 1867, federal elections were organised by government officials, with no independent body in charge.

title: Election 2025: Who Is Kim Campbell, Canada's First Woman Prime Minister
content: As Canada prepares for the 2025 federal elections, one name stands out in the country's political history - Kim Campbell.

title: Pakistan Cites Right To Suspend "All Bilateral Pacts, Including Simla"
content: With its back against the wall and no other options available, Pakistan's top committee on security met today and after an hours-long discussion decided to mirror India's actions in the wake of the terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam.

title: Assam MLA Arrested For Pulwama, Pahalgam "Government Conspiracy Comment
content: An MLA in Assam has been arrested over his comments on the terror attacks in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam and Pulwama.

title: Student Kills Classmate, Injures 3 In Knife Attack In France
content: A student carried out a stabbing spree at a high school in northwestern France on Thursday, killing one classmate and wounding three others, a police source told AFP.

title: What Is The Simla Agreement And How Pak Has Violated It In The Past
content: India has ramped up its response to the Pahalgam terror attacks, revoking all visas issued to Pakistani nationals, including medical visas, and suspending visa services for Pakistanis.

title: "Many Who Helped": Pahalgam Hero Who Carried Injured Boy On His Back
content: The massive terror attack in Pahalgam, while spreading shock and horror, also threw up hope, with multiple heroes stepping forward from among the locals.

title: Karnataka Cabinet Passes Resolution Against Pahalgam Attack
content: The Karnataka cabinet passed a resolution against the Pahalgam terror attack during their meeting in Chamarajanagar on Thursday. The information was given by Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah while he was speaking to the reporters.

title: "Vladimir, Stop!" Trump On Russian Strikes On Kyiv Which Killed 8
content: President Donald Trump turned his criticism on Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday after Russia pounded Kyiv with missiles and drones overnight, saying "Vladimir, STOP!"

title: Adani Energy Solutions Registers Record Performance, Net Profit Up 103%
content: Adani Energy Solutions has ended January-March quarter and the entire financial year 2024-25 record high. The January-March quarter profit after tax rose 87 per cent to Rs 714 crore, as per a company statement.

title: Minerals for US, militants for Kashmir: Pak's double game behind J&K attack
content: In Jammu and Kashmir, terrorists attacked near Pahalgam. Twenty-eight people died in the assault. The Resistance Front claimed responsibility for the attack. The attack happened during US Vice President JD Vance’s India visit. Attackers demanded victims recite Islamic verses. Some survived by reciting the kalma. Pakistan's military posture and mineral ambitions are under scrutiny.

title: Security lapses, stricter action: Key points from all-party meet
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, an all-party meeting was convened where opposition leaders pledged their support to the government's counter-terrorism efforts. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh briefed attendees on the attack and subsequent government decisions, while security lapses were discussed. Opposition leaders uniformly condemned the attack, emphasising the need for peace in Kashmir and urging the government to take decisive action against terrorism.

title: PM Modi's warning rattles Pak as suspense builds over India's next move
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26 tourists, India has taken decisive steps signaling a strong response against Pakistan. Prime Minister Modi vowed to punish the terrorists and their backers, leading to the suspension of visa services for Pakistani nationals and the revocation of existing visas.

title: 'I am a Hindu - a proud one': Ex-Pakistan cricketer on Pahalgam terror attack
content: Former Pakistani cricketer Danish Kaneria criticized Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif for the Pahalgam terror attack, questioning his silence and accusing Pakistan of harboring terrorists. Kaneria defended his loyalty to Pakistan despite being Hindu, highlighting the discrimination faced by Hindus there. The Pahalgam attack — the deadliest since the 2019 Pulwama tragedy — drew widespread condemnation globally. Leaders from around the world, along with prominent voices from the cricketing fraternity and other industries, expressed their condolences to the victims and their families.

title: Cake delivery for Pakistan High Commission goes viral after Pahalgam attack
content: Amidst outrage over the Pahalgam terror attack that killed 28 tourists, a video showing a man carrying a cake to the Pakistan High Commission has sparked controversy. Simultaneously, protests erupted in Delhi, with demonstrators demanding decisive action against Pakistan.

title: ED raids Gensol office, co-founder Puneet Singh Jaggi detained
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) raided Gensol Engineering Ltd offices and detained co-promoter Puneet Singh Jaggi amid financial misconduct allegations. This action, triggered by a SEBI report, accuses the Jaggi brothers of diverting funds obtained from Power Finance Corporation and IREDA Ltd into assets held by promoters and shell companies.

title: Pakistan's Nadeem absent as players unveiled for Neeraj Chopra Classic
content: Bengaluru is set to host the Neeraj Chopra Classic on May 24. This Gold-Label javelin meet will feature top international athletes. Anderson Peters, Thomas Rohler, and Julius Yego are among the stars. Arshad Nadeem will miss the event due to the Asian Athletics Championships. The competition aims to inspire Indian athletes.

title: Microsoft HR head gives employees 5 days 'deadline' to ... or leave the company
content: Microsoft is implementing a new performance strategy, offering underperforming employees a severance package of 16 weeks' pay to voluntarily leave instead of entering a Performance Improvement Plan (PIP). Employees have five days to decide, and those choosing the PIP forfeit the payout.

title: IAF conducts huge 'Aakraman' exercise amid rising India-Pak tensions
content: The Indian Air Force is conducting Exercise Aakraman, a large-scale operational drill in the central sector, featuring Rafale jets and other frontline aircraft. The exercise focuses on advanced mission profiles, including ground attack and electronic warfare, with assets deployed from multiple airbases. This drill comes amid heightened tensions with Pakistan and showcases the IAF's enhanced strategic capabilities with modern weaponry.

title: 'For the last 78 years ... ': Gavaskar's emotional outburst on Live TV
content: Sunil Gavaskar passionately condemned the Pahalgam terror attack during a live IPL broadcast, questioning the purpose of the violence and urging for peace. BCCI Secretary Devajit Saikia also issued a strong statement, expressing condolences and solidarity with the victims' families. The BCCI further conveyed its condolences via social media, standing in support of those affected by the tragic event.

title: Elon Musk replies to Vice President JD Vance's family photos from Taj Mahal: One of the ...
content: US Vice President JD Vance, accompanied by his family, recently visited the Taj Mahal during a four-day trip to India. Vance shared photos on X, with Elon Musk commenting on the monument's beauty. The family's visit included a warm welcome from Uttar Pradesh's Chief Minister and stringent security measures along their route.

title: Class act! Yashasvi Jaiswal ahead of Virat Kohli in rare record
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal etched his name in IPL history during the 2025 match against Royal Challengers Bengaluru, smashing a six off the very first ball. This feat marked his third time achieving this, making him the record holder for most sixes on the first ball of an innings. Earlier, Royal Challengers Bengaluru posted a competitive 205 for five, powered by fluent half-centuries from Virat Kohli (70 off 42) and Devdutt Padikkal (50 off 27).

title: 'A king is one who ...': Viv Richards makes big Babar Azam comment
content: Sir Vivian Richards has voiced his support for Babar Azam amidst his current struggles, assuring fans of his imminent return to form. Despite recent poor performances and being dropped from the T20I squad, Richards remains confident in Babar's resilience. Salman Iqbal predicts Babar will surpass even Virat Kohli upon his resurgence, comparing him to legends like Garry Sobers.

title: 'Lied to his wife that he was alive': Operator who rushed navy officer to ambulance
content: In Pahalgam, Kashmir, a terror attack killed Navy Lieutenant Vinay Narwal. He was honeymooning with his wife, Himanshi, when gunmen attacked. Irshad Ahmad, a local, helped them after the shooting. Narwal, recently married, died at the scene. His family in Karnal mourns the loss. The Navy and community remember him as a dedicated officer. Authorities are investigating the attack.

title: Netanyahu and Meloni dial PM Modi, condemn Pulwama attack
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu called PM Modi, condemning the act and expressing solidarity. Numerous global leaders, including those from France and Canada, have also voiced strong condemnation. India has convened a Cabinet Committee on Security, resolving to hold perpetrators accountable and announcing retaliatory measures, including suspending the Indus Waters Treaty and reducing diplomatic staff.

title: 'I wish I'd died': England cricket legend's devastating revelation
content: Andrew Flintoff, the former England cricket captain, has opened up about the profound impact of his near-fatal car crash during Top Gear filming in 2022. He candidly admits that he felt it would have been "much easier" if he had died, revealing the depth of his despair following the incident. Flintoff retired from cricket in 2010 at the age of 31, having represented England in 79 Test matches between 1998 and 2009.

title: 'Vladimir, STOP!': In rare criticism, Donald Trump urges Putin to end war
content: Donald Trump criticized Vladimir Putin following a massive Russian strike on Ukraine that resulted in casualties and significant damage. Trump urged Putin to stop the attacks, citing heavy troop losses and advocating for a peace deal. The strikes targeted Ukraine's aviation, aerospace, and defense industries, prompting President Zelenskyy to condemn Russia's actions and appeal for international awareness and accountability.

title: 'They kept on laughing till my husband died': Wife laments inadequate security
content: Shital Kalathiya, wife of slain Surat banker Shailesh Kalathiya, has demanded justice following the Pahalgam terror attack. At her husband's funeral, attended by ministers and a large crowd, she criticized the security arrangements in Jammu and Kashmir. She alleged security forces failed to protect citizens and questioned why VIPs receive preferential treatment while her husband lacked essential security.

title: Assam Police arrests AIUDF MLA Aminul Islam over remarks on Pahalgam attack
content: Assam Police arrested AIUDF MLA Aminul Islam for allegedly making derogatory remarks about the Pahalgam terror attack during a public gathering. His statement, deemed misleading and instigating, went viral, prompting charges under the Bharatiya Nyay Samhita. Chief Minister Sarma vowed strong action against anyone defending the attack.

title: Royals skipper Parag gives massive update on Sanju Samson
content: Rajasthan Royals fans are hopeful as Riyan Parag shares that Sanju Samson is nearing his return from a finger injury. Samson's absence has impacted the team's performance, with the Royals currently struggling in the standings. Parag has stepped up as captain, making strategic changes like bringing in Fazalhaq Farooqi, while eagerly awaiting Samson's comeback to revitalize the team's season.

title: All Pakistan nationals ordered to leave India within 72 hrs
content: India has suspended all visas for Pakistani citizens. They must leave the country by April 27. Medical visas are valid until April 29. This decision follows the Pahalgam terror attack. PM Narendra Modi vowed to punish those responsible. Indians are advised against traveling to Pakistan. Those in Pakistan should return home soon.

title: 'This is bizarre': Princess Isabella breaks royal protocol for 18th bday photo
content: ​Princess Isabella of Denmark is the second child and the elder daughter of King Frederik X and Queen Mary. She is the fourth grandchild and oldest granddaughter of Queen Margrethe II and Prince Henrik. She was the first girl born into the Danish royal family since the birth of her great aunt, Queen Anne-Marie of Greece, in 1946.

title: ‘Very close’: India may be first to sign trade pact, says US treasury secy
content: India may soon be the first nation to strike a bilateral trade deal with the US under President Trump's reciprocal tariff policy, according to US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent. Negotiations are reportedly near a breakthrough, facilitated by India's relatively low tariffs and minimal trade barriers.

title: 'Act of war': Pak reacts to India's big move after J&K attack
content: Following a terrorist attack in Pahalgam, Prime Minister Modi pledged decisive action against those responsible, vowing to "identify, track, and punish" the perpetrators. Pakistan responded sharply, warning that any threat to its sovereignty would be met with "firm reciprocal measures." Islamabad condemned India's suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty as an "Act of War," and took retaliatory measures, including airspace closure, trade suspension, and the expulsion of Indian military advisors.

title: Air pollution in US: These 10 major cities are most affected
content: A new report from the American Lung Association reveals that over 25 million more Americans are breathing polluted air, increasing health risks. Climate events like wildfires and heatwaves are worsening air quality, especially in the West Coast and areas affected by Canadian wildfires.

title: Shami calls Hardik Pandya 'bhai' and asks for his autograph
content: Rohit Sharma's brilliant 70 and a 53-run partnership with Suryakumar Yadav propelled Mumbai Indians to a dominant seven-wicket victory over Sunrisers Hyderabad. Mumbai chased down the 144-run target with ease, securing their fourth consecutive win. Earlier, Heinrich Klaasen's 71 helped SRH recover to 143/8, but it wasn't enough to stop Mumbai's momentum.

title: 'Got invite to all-party meet': Owaisi after urging PM Modi to include small parties
content: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi initially criticized the Centre for excluding smaller parties from the all-party meeting on the Pahalgam terror attack. He highlighted that every party with parliamentary representation deserves a voice on this national issue. Subsequently, Owaisi received an invitation following his remarks and confirmed his attendance.

title: Pahalgam attack: 9-yr-old lights father's pyre after mother faints
content: Nine-year-old Tanuj Kumar Satpathy tragically lit his father Prashant's funeral pyre in Balasore, Odisha, after Prashant was killed in the Pahalgam terror attack. Grieving relatives struggled as Prashant's wife, Priya Darshini, clung to his body. The funeral was attended by hundreds, including Chief Minister Mohan Charan Majhi.

title: Gulki Joshi reacts to being approached for Khatron Ke Khiladi
content: Gulki Joshi expressed her strong interest in joining the upcoming season of Khatron Ke Khiladi, revealing she was initially approached but received no further updates. Despite her eagerness and love for balancing and aerial stunts, Joshi remains uncertain about her participation, especially with rumors circulating about the show's potential cancellation.

title: Pakistan captain Rizwan loses cool, throws helmet: Watch
content: Islamabad United showcased a dominant batting display, securing a convincing seven-wicket victory over Multan Sultans in their recent PSL encounter. Andries Gous's explosive unbeaten 80 led United's successful chase of 169, overshadowing Usman Khan's earlier 61 for the Sultans. Mohammad Rizwan's frustration was evident as Multan struggled to contain Islamabad's fluent response.

title: Pakistan Super League to stop streaming in India: Here’s why
content: FanCode has suspended the broadcast of PSL 2025 in India, effective immediately, following the tragic terror attack in Pahalgam, Jammu and Kashmir, which resulted in the loss of many lives. The decision reflects the national sentiment and sensitivity towards the incident. During the IPL match, players honored the victims with black armbands and a moment of silence.

title: Sikh pilgrims allowed to enter Pakistan as India closes Attari border
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack and India's subsequent actions against Pakistan, the Attari border crossing is closed, but the Dera Baba Nanak ICP remains open. Approximately 250 Sikh pilgrims crossed into Pakistan via the Kartarpur Corridor to visit Gurdwara Kartarpur Sahib.

title: India’s youngest Asiad medallist, now only woman at World C'ships: Anahat
content: Anahat Singh, a 17-year-old squash player, has qualified for the World Squash Championships. She defeated Toby Tse in the Asian qualifiers. Anahat is the youngest Indian to achieve this feat. Her family has a strong sports background. She was initially inspired by P V Sindhu to play badminton but then switched to squash.

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Indian Navy test fires missile in Arabian Sea
content: INS Surat, the Indian Navy's advanced destroyer, successfully test-fired a medium-range surface-to-air missile with a 70-km range in the Arabian Sea. Commissioned in January 2025, the ship showcases India's naval self-reliance with 75% indigenous content. This test occurs after PM Modi's strong warning to terrorists following the Pahalgam attack, vowing decisive action and justice.

title: He is 95, lives alone, and is happier and healthier than ever: Here’s how
content: At 95, Dr. Bankey Lal Sharma exemplifies a fulfilling life through routine, mental clarity, and emotional strength. There’s no miracle cure to living a long and joyful life. But Dr Bankey Lal Sharma’s story offers something even more valuable—a blueprint for emotional richness and inner peace. Through discipline, solitude, and simplicity, he has created a life full of meaning.

title: 'Every drop is ours by right': Pakistan reacts to suspension of Indus Waters Treaty
content: Pakistan's power minister responded strongly to India's suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty, calling it an act of "water warfare." This reaction follows India's announcement of retaliatory measures against Pakistan for allegedly supporting cross-border terrorism, including holding the treaty in abeyance and imposing travel restrictions. Tensions escalate as both nations take firm stances.

title: 'Would’ve been better if they killed us Kashmiris’: Hawker who braved bullets
content: In a powerful act of bravery and compassion, Sajad Ahmad Bhat, a shawl hawker from Pahalgam, carried injured tourists to safety after the terror attack in Baisaran Valley that killed 28. Responding selflessly, Sajad and others rushed to aid victims, offering water and support. His gesture has drawn widespread praise, showcasing Kashmir’s humanity amid tragedy.

title: Steve Kerr makes his feelings known about Jimmy Butler after pelvis injury
content: Steve Kerr expressed concern for Jimmy Butler after he suffered a pelvis contusion during Wednesday's loss to the Rockets. Kerr stated that Thompson's contact with Butler was unintentional and a clean play. Jonathan Kuminga stepped up in Butler's absence, scoring 11 points, while maintaining a positive attitude despite recent bench time, and is ready to contribute.

title: Kesari Chapter 2' box office collection day 7 nears Rs 50 Cr
content: Kesari Chapter 2 is performing well at the box office. The movie earned Rs 39.00 crore in India in six days. The film had a strong opening weekend. Despite a mid-week slowdown, theater occupancy remains decent. Akshay Kumar's performance is receiving praise. Positive word of mouth is helping the film. Trade analysts predict a good second weekend for the movie.

title: 'Time to destroy remaining land of terror': PM hints at big action after J&K attack
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has vowed decisive action against those responsible for the Pahalgam terror attack, which claimed 28 lives. Addressing the nation, he promised to identify, track, and punish the perpetrators, assuring that terrorists will face unprecedented consequences.

title: Woman, who refused to attend Estonia award to look after buffalo, nominated in NY fest
content: Eighty-year-old Hira Devi, a farmer from Uttarakhand, and co-star Padam Singh, a retired soldier, have been nominated for Best Actor at the New York Indian Film Festival for their roles in Pyre. Directed by Vinod Kapri, the film captures their real lives in a ghost village. Despite no prior acting experience, their poignant performances have earned global acclaim.

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Why PM Modi switched to English at Bihar rally
content: Following the deadly Pahalgam attack, Prime Minister Narendra Modi issued a stern warning, vowing to identify, track, and punish every terrorist and their backers. Speaking in Bihar's Madhubani, Modi declared India's resolve to pursue them to the ends of the Earth, switching to English to address the international community. ""Every effort will be made to ensure justice is done, entire nation is firm in resolve," he said.

title: Kanye West hosts casting calls in his warehouse; enraged neighbors complain
content: Controversial artist Kanye West faces backlash in L.A.'s Larchmont neighborhood due to disruptive activities near his warehouse. Residents complain of loud music, including West's own songs, and disturbing 'URGENT' casting call advertisements. Allegations include swastika imagery and concerns about the impact on children near a school. Law enforcement has received multiple complaints, with investigations ongoing into potential hate crimes.

title: Why Nico Iamaleava soured on Tennessee and ended up at UCLA
content: Iamaleava was set to make around $2.4 million at Tennessee this year, sources say . sources close to the quarterback deny they were seeking $4 million . he needed to take a "mental break" after the Vols' 42-17 loss to the college football world .

title: NBA playoff odds: Celtics win again, on collision course with West favorite Thunder
content: the top-seeded Oklahoma City Thunder entered the playoffs as favorites to win the NBA championship . the Los Angeles Lakers , Golden State Warriors , LA Clippers , Denver Nuggets and Minnesota Timberwolves all have better odds . they have traded series-favorite status with their Game 1 and Game 2 wins .

title: Expert's picks, best bets: Can Machado Garry elude Prates' hard strikes?
content: welterweight contenders Ian Machado Garry and Carlos Prates will clash to determine who moves closer to a title shot at UFC Fight Night on sunday . the fight follows the first loss of his career against Shavkat Rakhmonov in December .

title: Power Rankings: Who's No. 1 one month into the season?
content: just 2.5 games separate four teams -- three of which have winning percentages above .600 -- in the NL West . in the american league, while the Yankees are playing as well as projected, a number of teams are hovering around .500, the Orioles are scuffling and the Twins have the second-worst record in the league .

content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . 40 lakh of unaccountable items were seized by police on friday . the police have seized a total of  40 lakh .
